title: Scrambled Eggs in a Mug Recipe
description: Microwave an egg in a cup with some milk and a pinch of pepper and you'll have light, fluffy, scrambled eggs in minutes with no messy pans to clean.
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Breakfast and Brunch Eggs Scrambled Scrambled Eggs in a Mug 4.6 (70) 59 Reviews 16 Photos For delicious scrambled eggs, microwave one egg in a cup with a bit of milk and pepper for each person in your family. It's quick and easy, and there will be no messy pan to clean. Submitted by Delicious! Updated on April 7, 2023 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 16 16 16 16 Cook Time: 5 mins Total Time: 5 mins Servings: 1 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 1 servings 1 large egg 1 tablespoon milk 1 pinch ground black pepper (Optional) Directions Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Crack egg into a microwave-safe mug; beat until even in color. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Pour in milk and beat until light yellow in color. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Microwave on high until cooked through and fluffy, about 90 seconds. Season with pepper and serve. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios I Made It Print 98 home cooks made it! If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Scrambled Eggs in a Mug 01 of 16 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 16 Photo by  FunCane7675 08/06/2023 Amazing but if you have small eggs I would add two 03 of 16 Photo by  DreamyPea3806 06/02/2022 very easy and good results! 04 of 16 Photo by  Sarah Johnston 07/27/2020 05 of 16 Photo by  Jennifer Collins 01/30/2020 Added cheese. Yummy! 06 of 16 Photo by  Michelle Mittleman 08/26/2019 07 of 16 Photo by  Lyssa 08/05/2019 08 of 16 Photo by  msssblondie 04/20/2019 09 of 16 Photo by  Jane Murphy 12/16/2018 10 of 16 Photo by  faith 11/07/2018 This was really good. I used three eggs and added spinach and a few of my own spices. I microwaved it for 90 seconds, stirred it, then zapped it again for another 20 seconds or so. The eggs were nice and fluffy and they definitely don’t get cold quickly in the mug. The one complaint is that the mug doesn’t come clean in the dishwasher. Needed to scrub it by hand. Will most likely make again. 1 2 Next You’ll Also Love Microwave Longaniza con Huevos Fluffy Microwave Scrambled Eggs 137 Ratings Green Chile Microwave Scrambled Eggs 1 Rating Microwave Scrambled Eggs 6 Ratings Black Bean Breakfast Bowl 134 Ratings Ham and Cheese Chop Chop 19 Ratings Creamy Cottage Cheese Scrambled Eggs 184 Ratings Sriracha Scrambled Eggs 26 Ratings Easy Fluffy Scrambled Eggs 65 Ratings Best Scrambled Eggs 73 Ratings Chorizo con Huevos (Spicy Mexican Sausage with Eggs) 38 Ratings Zucchini with Egg 17 Ratings Green Chile Tortilla Scramble 11 Ratings Nesquik® Brownie in a Mug 37 Ratings Scrambled Eggs with Chorizo 32 Ratings Apple Crisp in a Mug 17 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Delicious!
instructions: Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Crack egg into a microwave-safe mug; beat until even in color. Season with pepper and serve. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios
